pull_request.title: Fix size of coke can, 12cm instead of 31cm height

pullrequest.title: Fix size of coke can, 12cm instead of 31cm height

content.raw:
I changed both the inertia and the pose of it\(sdf 1.4 and 1.5\).  
Used the following parameters:  
m = 0.390 kg  
h = 0.12m  
r = 0.03m  
Inertia modeled as solid cylinder, formulas taken from [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List\_of\_moments\_of\_inertia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_moments_of_inertia)

Set the ‘pose’ of the inertia to the center, so I removed the weird offset of ~1cm in both x and y.
content.html:
I changed both the inertia and the pose of it(sdf 1.4 and 1.5).
Used the following parameters:
m = 0.390 kg
h = 0.12m
r = 0.03m
Inertia modeled as solid cylinder, formulas taken from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_moments_of_inertia

Set the ‘pose’ of the inertia to the center, so I removed the weird offset of ~1cm in both x and y.

pullrequest.title: Fix size of coke can, 12cm instead of 31cm height

content.raw:
Indeed, sloppy again. I fixed it, but now the inertia is much lower, but I am 100% sure that I calculated it correct. 

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/1236017497-Screenshot_from_2019-03-11_22-43-19.png)
content.html: Indeed, sloppy again. I fixed it, but now the inertia is much lower, but I am 100% sure that I calculated it correct.

pull_request.title: Fix size of coke can, 12cm instead of 31cm height

pullrequest.title: Fix size of coke can, 12cm instead of 31cm height

content.html:
for izz I get 0.0001755

‌

>>> m = 0.390
>>> h = 0.12
>>> r = 0.03
>>> (1/12) * m * (3 * r * r + h * h)
0.00055575
>>> 0.5 * m * r * r
0.0001755

content.raw:
This looks great! One last comment, the visualized inertia looks a bit big. Maybe ~0.06m is the diameter of a can, so it should be divided by 2 for the radius?

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/887257337-coke_can_inertia.png)
content.html: This looks great! One last comment, the visualized inertia looks a bit big. Maybe ~0.06m is the diameter of a can, so it should be divided by 2 for the radius?

pullrequest.title: Fix size of coke can, 12cm instead of 31cm height

content.raw:
Seems reasonable.

‌

Removing the offset from the inertial makes sense. I would add that weird offset scaled by the inch to mm conversion to the `<visual>` and `<collision>`. It looks like the mesh is offset from the center of mass when viewed orthographically from above.

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/1517817813-coke_can_top_ortho.png)
content.html:
Seems reasonable.

‌

Removing the offset from the inertial makes sense. I would add that weird offset scaled by the inch to mm conversion to the <visual> and <collision>. It looks like the mesh is offset from the center of mass when viewed orthographically from above.

‌
